Illusion

I feel the hard line of decision The fangs of necessity at throat And your majesty of illusion which Makes me bow. If fragility is a crime It is yours, exquisitely - if Passion is your dream then let us Walk together, sleeping and Growing not old. Too much is a word from your lips, and sometimes Too little. There are reasons for No reason and lies painting truth about Ecstasy remembered and loveless projection And where are you, where am I when Time inches past and pain is only dull; When money like water puddles in the sun And the heat is a rough hand pushing? I am next to your skin with my teeth Beneath the flower of your pride With my palms at your weak side At arms to your defense.

Be it for you that I am invisible Be it your name that holds thick pleasure For this soldier at peace. Be it unspoken the conversation, And unwritten the pact that Brings my food to your table and your fingers to my cheek, your words to my canvas and if I regret again, as I did being lost, it will be that I wasn't lost with you Sooner. Because this is a shadow fallen, We are a wooden floor together, uncracked

There is nothing else

By Krister Axel on 02/14 2000 at 17_00 in Poetry
